title.value: Relationship between prediction accuracy and feature importance reliability: An empirical and theoretical study
title.justification: The title explicitly discusses the relationship between prediction accuracy and feature importance reliability, which is the central topic of the paper.
title.quote: Relationship between prediction accuracy and feature importance reliability: An empirical and theoretical study

extractions.description: This paper explores the relationship between prediction accuracy and feature importance reliability in neuroimaging data, both empirically and theoretically. It utilizes various predictive models and the Adolescent Brain Cognitive Development (ABCD) dataset to analyze this relationship. The study demonstrates how Haufe-transformed weights can achieve reliable feature importance and discusses the implications of prediction accuracy across phenotypes.

type.justification: The paper presents both empirical findings from analyzing neuroimaging data and theoretical insights into feature importance reliability and prediction accuracy.
type.quote: Relationship between prediction accuracy and feature importance reliability: An empirical and theoretical study

name.justification: The paper focuses on using neuroimaging data for behavioral predictions, making neuroimaging the primary field of research.
name.quote: There is significant interest in using neuroimaging data to predict behavior.

name.justification: The paper is heavily centered around analyzing and interpreting predictive models in the context of neuroimaging.
name.quote: One approach to interpret predictive models is the computation of feature-level importance.

name.justification: KRR is one of the predictive models evaluated in the study for its performance on neuroimaging data.
name.quote: We considered four commonly used prediction models: kernel ridge regression (KRR), linear ridge regression (LRR), least absolute shrinkage and selection operator (LASSO), and Random Forest (RF) models.

is_contributed.justification: KRR is a well-established model not introduced in this paper.
is_contributed.quote: KRR is a powerful approach for resting-FC behavioral prediction ( He et al., 2020 ).

is_executed.justification: KRR is executed in the experiments conducted within this paper.
is_executed.quote: Kernel ridge regression (KRR) models across different sample sizes, interpretation methods, and behavioral domains.

is_compared.justification: KRR is compared to other models such as LRR, LASSO, and RF.
is_compared.quote: Compared to other methods, KRR was also evaluated for its consistency and reliability.

referenced_paper_title.value: Deep neural networks and kernel regression achieve comparable accuracies for functional connectivity prediction of behavior and demographics.
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced studies further elaborate on KRR's utility and prior implementations.
referenced_paper_title.quote: He, T., Kong, R., Holmes, A.J., Nguyen, M., Sabuncu, M.R., Eickhoff, S.B., Bzdok, D., Feng, J., Yeo, B.T.T., 2020. Deep neural networks and kernel regression achieve comparable accuracies for functional connectivity prediction of behavior and demographics.

name.justification: The ABCD dataset is central to the empirical study conducted in the paper.
name.quote: In the present study, we used the Adolescent Brain Cognitive Development (ABCD) study to investigate the relationship between prediction accuracy and feature importance reliability.

referenced_paper_title.value: A description of the ABCD organizational structure and communication framework.
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced title elaborates on the ABCD dataset and its structure, which the current paper employs.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Auchter, A.M., Hernandez Mejia, M., Heyser, C.J., Shilling, P.D., Jernigan, T.L., Brown, S.A., Tapert, S.F., Dowling, G.J., 2018. A description of the ABCD organizational structure and communication framework.

name.justification: FreeSurfer is mentioned as a tool used for MRI processing in this study.
name.quote: The structural data were further processed using FreeSurfer 5.3.0.

referenced_paper_title.value: Cortical surface-based analysis. I. Segmentation and surface reconstruction.
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper provides background on the FreeSurfer software used in this study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Dale, A.M., Fischl, B., Sereno, M.I., 1999. Cortical surface-based analysis. I. Segmentation and surface reconstruction.
